data.title: Compile error under linux and windows. Commit 30d4889
data.body:
under Linux:

```
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -liconv
```

under Windows:

```
 LINK : fatal error LNK1181: cannot open input file 'iconv.windows.tools.lib'
```

data.title: Ask confirmation on closing a scene tab
data.body: Please close #2662

data.title: Fix SplitContainer bool properties
data.body: Change the SplitContainer collapsed and dragger_visible properties from int to bool.

data.title: Fixes Visual Studio compile error due to pe_bliss
data.body:
Compile error: C2039: 'min': is not a member of 'std'
Reason: #2518 introduced pe_bliss

Fix: Need to include algorithm header before string, otherwise std:min cannot be used while compiling with Visual Studio 2015 / 2013. Should not have any effect on other platforms, because algorithm is a standard header.
See: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17409956

By the way: #2822 fixes another Visual Studio compile error. After merging both, builds succeed.

data.title: HTTPClient docs & request functionality + fixes
data.body:
This should fix https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2821

I've documented HTTPClient a bit since I've been working with/on it.
I've added a method to create x-www-form-urlencoded style escaped http request strings in order to facilitate GET and POST requests a little easier.

Also fixes the documentation creation scripts since they were failing due to <, > and & signs being present in method descriptions.

data.title: Fix Windows Export
Mismatched number of arguments in call to EditorExportPlatformPC::export_project
data.body:
As seen in the current master branch, on gcc 4.9.2:

```
g++ -o platform/windows/export/export.x11.opt.tools.64.o -c -O2 -ffast-math -DDEBUG_ENABLED -DFREETYPE_ENABLED -DOPENGL_ENABLED -DGLEW_ENABLED -DALSA_ENABLED -DPULSEAUDIO_ENABLED -DX11_ENABLED -DUNIX_ENABLED -DGLES2_ENABLED -DGLES_OVER_GL -DMUSEPACK_ENABLED -DSQUISH_ENABLED -DVORBIS_ENABLED -DOPUS_ENABLED -DTHEORA_ENABLED -DPNG_ENABLED -DDDS_ENABLED -DPVR_ENABLED -DJPG_ENABLED -DWEBP_ENABLED -DSPEEX_ENABLED -DTOOLS_ENABLED -DGDSCRIPT_ENABLED -DMINIZIP_ENABLED -DXML_ENABLED -DETC1_ENABLED -D_REENTRANT -Icore -Icore/math -Itools -Idrivers -I. -Iplatform/x11 -I/usr/include/freetype2 -I/usr/include/libpng16 -Itools/vorbis -Idrivers/opus/silk/float -Idrivers/opus -Idrivers/opus/celt -Idrivers/opus/silk -Idrivers/opus/silk/float platform/windows/export/export.cpp
platform/windows/export/export.cpp: In member function 'Error EditorExportPlatformWindows::export_project(const String&, bool, bool, bool)':
platform/windows/export/export.cpp:202:92: error: no matching function for call to 'EditorExportPlatformWindows::export_project(const String&, bool&, bool&, bool&)'
  Error err = EditorExportPlatformPC::export_project(p_path, p_debug, p_dumb, p_remote_debug);
                                                                                            ^
platform/windows/export/export.cpp:202:92: note: candidate is:
In file included from platform/windows/export/export.h:1:0,
                 from platform/windows/export/export.cpp:30:
./tools/editor/editor_import_export.h:200:16: note: virtual Error EditorExportPlatformPC::export_project(const String&, bool, int)
  virtual Error export_project(const String& p_path, bool p_debug, int p_flags=0);
                ^
./tools/editor/editor_import_export.h:200:16: note:   candidate expects 3 arguments, 4 provided
```

data.title: Revert "Ignore alpha materials in baked light ray-tracer."
data.body: Reverts godotengine/godot#2717. This way of excluding objects is too slow, please avoid adding the triangles in the first place instead of doing it in the raytracer

data.title: RegEx class documentation updated to reflect latest changes.
2D/3D/Script views changing not working after using new Search Help button
data.body: When you use new Search Help button in Script Editor and select one entry, you can't change view nor by buttons and hotkeys F1/2/3. Only using Scene docker by clicking nodes or script buttons works.

data.title: Added tooltip for a few buttons in sample library editor
data.body: Cleaned up verson of #2681.

data.title: Android add FA(persian) locale strings
Popup Always on Top option
data.body:
The option ("TopMost" for windows users) let's you work outside the dialog while keeping it visible. If another always on top dialog is clicked, this one will be raised to the front.

A quick usage example is with plugin dialogs that need to be visible while working with the editor.

I find this very useful, but I am not sure if modals were made to behave this way~

data.title: Split up AnimationPlayer tracks editor `Tracks` button
data.body:
Currently, many users overlook the "Tracks" button in the tracks editor of the AnimationPlayer, causing them to miss out on features like "Call Func Tracks". I assume most see it as a something like a "panel title", since ToolButtons are flat in normal state.

This change splits up this button into two buttons:
-  An `Add Tracks` button with a `+` icon, containing options to insert a new track of any of the three types
-  A `Track Tools` button with a gear icon, containing the other menu options previously contained in the `Tracks` button

The change also moves the new buttons to the opposite end of the editor, where the other buttons are positioned as well.

![tracks](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6996191/11255758/41b942d2-8e48-11e5-8587-660e9deb911e.png)
Since these buttons now both use icons rather than text, it should be more obvious they're buttons.

data.title: Improve error log colours in the Windows terminal
data.body:
This is a follow-up to #2737 where terminal colours were improved for Unix. A similar improvement could be done for the Windows terminal, and both @ZuBsPaCe and @vnen have already been looking into it:
- https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/2737#issuecomment-155610141
- https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/2737#issuecomment-155625066

Maybe one of you two would like to handle this one directly?

data.title: HBoxContainer: The order of elements is not updated on viewport.
data.body:
1  Put some buttons as children of a HboxContainer, 
2  Change the order of buttons in scene editor (move node up / move node down),

issue:
The order of elements is not updated on viewport.

expected:
real-time update.

ps: The elements get updated only if I use hide and unhide in scene editor.

godot 2.0 alpha

data.title: HBox- and VBoxContainer: The order of elements is not updated on viewport.
data.body:
1  Put some buttons as children of an HBox- or VBoxContainer, 
2  Change the order of buttons in scene editor (move node up / move node down),

issue:
The order of elements is not updated on viewport.

expected:
real-time update.

ps: The elements get updated only if I use hide and unhide in scene editor.

godot 2.0 alpha

data.title: 2D shapes editor update
data.body:
ShapeLine2D is now graphically editable.
ConvexPolygon2D point array is now editable.
Con(vex|cave)Polygon2D now respond to any modifications to their point array on the editor.

data.title: suggest to split script files and help reference
data.body:
I tested with commit 18e014a193840141911789aacf57b28a2e001724.
I found help tab removed and can open many help reference.
It looks good.
But, I feel not comfortable to see all opened gdscript with help reference in one list.

How about split list to show gdscript and reference separately?

![godot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8281454/11236681/9637874e-8e1e-11e5-803b-a705e1bd383d.jpg)

data.title: Still collision after removing/freeing CollisionPolygon2D node
data.body:
I have this structure:

```
Area2D
     -> Node2D
           -> CollisionPolygon2D
```

If I `free()` or `remove_child()` the Node2D Object or the CollisionPolygon2D there will still be collisions detected.

data.title: Baked light overrides fog
data.body: Just what the headline says. When you switch on fog in a WorldEnvironment, all baked lights make the fog brighter (unless you use plain white fog), so that you can actually see some of the geometry that would normally be invisible.

data.title: HTML5 Windows Export Bad File Endings
Wrong word in docs
data.body:
# if/else/elif

Simple conditions are created by using the if/else/elif syntax. Parenthesis around statements is allowed, but not **requiered**. Given the nature of the tab-based indentation, elif can be used instead of else:/if: to mantain a level of indentation.

at https://github.com/godotengine/godot/wiki/gdscript

data.title: Change handling of invalid JSON escape sequences.
data.body: Instead of reporting an error, just ignore the first backslash and continue. Fixes #2521.

data.title: Fly camera?
data.body:
Blender and Unreal Engine has it, pretty easy to implement and way easier in orienting cameras and lights in 3D view :)

Same question was asked on [/r/godot](https://www.reddit.com/r/godot/comments/3oqd2h/can_i_fly_the_camera_to_a_desired_position/)
